Operation 'get_/translate/braille' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is conversational but lacks clarity on inputs/outputs. Added explicit summary, clarified input/output formats, and specified the use case for AI agent routing.

data.current_description: Translate from English to Braille. This is what you use if you have a braille display. This API translates the English text into characters that a braille display understands and you can feed the translated text directly to the display.
data.summary_suggestion: Translate English text to Braille display characters
data.description_suggestion: Converts English text to Braille characters compatible with physical Braille displays. Accepts English text as input and returns translated Braille characters that can be directly fed to a Braille display device. Use this endpoint when targeting hardware Braille display output.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is conversational but lacks clarity on inputs/outputs. Added explicit summary, clarified input/output formats, and specified the use case for AI agent routing.

message: Operation 'get_/translate/braille/dots' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, unclear_purpose. Missing summary. Description uses vague language ('see which dots', 'potentially drive'). Clarified that this returns dot pattern data, specified input/output formats, and explained both educational and technical use cases for AI agents.

data.current_description: Use this to see which dots are enabled for each Braille letters. This is highly educational (to see which dots are enabled) and can potentially drive a non braille display which works on individual dots.
data.summary_suggestion: Translate English to Braille dot patterns
data.description_suggestion: Converts English text to Braille dot patterns, returning which dots are enabled for each Braille character. Accepts English text as input and returns dot configuration data for each character. Useful for educational purposes and for driving dot-matrix displays that render individual Braille dots.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description uses vague language ('see which dots', 'potentially drive'). Clarified that this returns dot pattern data, specified input/output formats, and explained both educational and technical use cases for AI agents.

message: Operation 'get_/translate/braille/html' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, inconsistent_terminology. Missing summary. Description says 'Image characters' but endpoint is 'html' - inconsistent terminology. Replaced vague 'probably what you want' with clear use case. Specified input/output formats and clarified HTML format for web rendering.

data.current_description: Translate from English to Braille Image characters. This is probably what you want to use if you are displaying braille in a browser.
data.summary_suggestion: Translate English to Braille HTML characters
data.description_suggestion: Converts English text to Braille characters in HTML format suitable for web browser display. Accepts English text as input and returns HTML-formatted Braille characters. Use this endpoint when rendering Braille in web applications or browsers.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description says 'Image characters' but endpoint is 'html' - inconsistent terminology. Replaced vague 'probably what you want' with clear use case. Specified input/output formats and clarified HTML format for web rendering.

data.description_suggestion: Converts English text to Braille in image format suitable for web browser display. Accepts English text as input and returns Braille as an image file. Use this endpoint when rendering Braille as images in web applications or browsers.

data.description_suggestion: Converts English text to Braille Unicode characters. Accepts English text as input and returns Unicode-encoded Braille characters. Use this endpoint for platform-independent Braille representation or when Unicode compatibility is required.
